meanings.definition: Writing materials such as paper, pens, and envelopes.
meanings.sent1: I bought some new stationeries for school.
meanings.sent2: She keeps her stationeries neatly organized on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The stationeries on the table seemed to be having a party.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stationeries was a rainbow of colors.
meanings.sent5: The stationeries gleamed under the bright light of the room.

meanings.sent1: His stationeries included fancy pens and decorative paper.
meanings.sent2: The stationeries in the drawer were a treasure trove of creativity.
meanings.sent3: The stationeries in the box whispered stories of inspiration.
meanings.sent4: Her stationeries were like a secret garden of ideas waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The stationeries overflowed from the shelves, ready for use.

meanings.definition: The quality of being stationary or immobile.
meanings.sent1: The stationeries of the old train made it a charming relic.
meanings.sent2: The stationeries of the ship gave it a majestic presence in the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The stationeries of the statue made it seem frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: The stationeries of the mountain range created a sense of permanence.
meanings.sent5: The stationeries of the ancient ruins held stories of the past.
